channel.title: Dependencies on Tech Notebook
channel.description: Recent content in Dependencies on Tech Notebook

item.title: Find all dependencies related to a package
item.description:
Introduction link

Sometimes it’s very practical to find all dependencies of a package. Here’s a useful command for this purpose.

Installation link

Installation:

 apt-get install apt-rdepends

Example search:

 $ apt-rdepends libapache2-mod-php5
Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree... Done
libapache2-mod-php5
 Depends: apache2-mpm-itk
 Depends: apache2-mpm-prefork (>> 2.0.52)

item.title: Debian: No More Dependency Errors When Configuring From Source
item.description:
Imagine you want to install the latest version of xyz from source on your Debian system. You run ./configure and… BLAM!!! You get a ton of errors because of libraries that aren’t installed.

Well, this won’t happen anymore, thanks to a very user-friendly utility called auto-apt.

To install it:

 apt-get install auto-apt

Then, enjoy the pleasure of ./configure without errors. To use it, just type:

 auto-apt run ./configure

instead. That’s all. If apt detects an error due to a missing file, it will kindly offer to install it for you.
